intro: Maerlensia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy maerlensia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are elongated, cylindrical berries that contain several seeds. Maerlensia hirsuta is often found in rocky or sandy soils in tropical and subtropical regions.
